Element.innerHTML.description: The `innerHTML` property sets or returns the HTML content (inner HTML) of an element.

Element.outerHTML.description: The `outerHTML` property sets or returns the HTML element and all it's content, including the start tag, it's attributes, and the end tag.

HTMLElement.innerText.description: The `innerText` property sets or returns the text content of the specified node, and all its descendants.

Node.textContent.description: The `textContent` property of the Node interface represents the text content of the node and its descendants.
